ygData.subject: Some people just don't get the FUN concept
ygData.msgSnippet: This story got me thinking.  Very shortly after joining my guild I was on as my rogue and knew none of the guildmembers who were on-line.  So I invited all of
ygData.messageBody:
This story got me thinking. Very shortly after joining my guild I was on as
my rogue and knew none of the guildmembers who were on-line. So I invited
all of them to come to Freeport and have a drink with me. Two of them were
IN freeport and didn't respond. I got one to come in from Oasis and another
from S Karana. We did nothing but drink, emote, and crack eachother up for
almost two hours.

That was about 4 months ago. I've recently been on as my bard in the same
guild fighting with 3 guildmates in Lavastorm. And it wasn't until I read
you post that I realized two of them are alts of the two that joined my
rogue for a drink and the third is one of their RL sisters. Finding great
players beats any loot, I say.

Peace
Evulia

> From: Scott Malin [mailto:Thanos0000@...]

> My ranger character (my bard is still stuck at 17th) had a
> good night about
> a month ago. I was in Steamfont collecting micro servos for a
> Trueshot bow
> when the Mino hero pops and starts killing the under 10 crowd
> around the
> caves. I was 39 at the time so I have SoW and figure I'll try
> kiting him. I
> got him to 1/2 health but I was nearly out of arrows and
> figured I might
> need to drop him on a guard when a 44th level druid swoops in
> and offers to
> help. Within 30 seconds there's a dead mino and the druid
> doesn't want any
> part of the shackle. I couldn't believe my good fortune. I
> needed to get off
> at that point but I made a point to go to Greater Faydark to
> celibrate my
> druid savior (he was a woodelf so I figured to do it in his home zone)
>
> I go and buy 9 bottles of something expensive, not sure what
> wine it was
> then setup by the newbie lift. I /rollplay and begin to shout
> my story to
> the zone. Finally near the end I call out to a first or
> second season (I
> didn't even use level and circle doesn't seem right for
> non-casters) ranger
> and druid to come to the top of the lift to drink a toast in
> the name of my
> savior. I didn't say I was going to give them a Mino axe,
> buffs and maybe
> some coin, I think I had a FS Scim for the druid, so you can
> imagine the
> reaction ... nothing. I shouted for several more minutes and
> finally got a
> 2nd level ranger. I gave him the axe, buffed him as well as I
> can and gave
> up, selling the extra wine back to the vendor.
>
> <sigh> at least I now have a Hero Bracers
>
> Underbrush
> 43rd level ranger of Tunare
> Reedwind
> 17th level bard
> Terris-Thule
>
